availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Wright. Father of Mary Wright, Luther Wright, William Wright, George Wright, Parmelia Wright, Martha Wright, John Wright, and Rob Wright. Farmer and merchant in Warren County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 106. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 163. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 43. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Elk Springs, p. 26. Find A Grave, “George W Wright (June 23, 1818-November 9, 1884)” Memorial #83392973, http://findagrave.com/memorial/83392973 (accessed on February 9, 1994).
